thread.title: Hepburn, Vestal capture STAC golf championships
thread.title_full: Hepburn, Vestal capture STAC golf championships

title: Hepburn, Vestal capture STAC golf championships
text:
Hepburn, Vestal capture STAC golf championships Tom Fleischman, tfleischman@ithacajournal.com | @TomF_IJSports 10:42 a.m. EDT October 14, 2015 Corning senior Alex Hepburn fired an even-par 71, highlighted by an eagle-3 at No. 13, to win the STAC golf championship Tuesday at Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Vestal won the team crown. Buy Photo Nick Barney, of Vestal, watches his tee shot at No. 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Barney shot a 4-over 75 and led the Golden Bears to the team championship. (Photo: SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo) Buy Photo Story Highlights Hepburn bogeyed the first three holes on the back nine before eagling No. 13 and birdieing No. 18 Three players finished tied for second at 2-over-par 73, two strokes behind Hepburn Vestal won its third team championship in the last six seasons with a team score of 393 STAC golfers resume play in the spring with the Section 4 medalist and state tournaments 1 CONNECT 15 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ITHACA After finishing nine holes in even-par 35, Corning senior Alex Hepburn made three straight bogeys and felt his chance at winning the Southern Tier Athletic Conference golf championship possibly slipping away. 
Three marvelous shots later, he was right back in the mix. 
Hepburn eagled the short par-5 13th hole at Cornell's Robert Trent Jones Course, putting him in the driver's seat for medalist honors. A birdie at the last sealed it, as Hepburn fired an even-par 71 to capture the individual title by two shots on a windswept Tuesday in Ithaca. Buy Photo Ryan Johnson of Norwich watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Johnson finished tied for second with a 73. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Tommy Davis of Seton Catholic Central watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Davis finished tied for second with a 73. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo D.J Griffiths of Susquehanna Valley watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Griffiths finished tied for second with a 73. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Alex Hepburn, of Corning, watches his tee shot fly on the 10th hole Tuesday on his way to winning the Southern Tier Athletic Conference golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Hepburn shot an even-par 71 and won by two shots. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Derran Smith, of Ithaca, watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Karl Hauptmann of Horseheads walks up the 6th fairway. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo DJ Griffiths Susquehanna Valley onto 6 green group 1a SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Kyle Norton of Chenango Forks misses a putt on the sixth green during the STAC golf championship Tuesday at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Kyle Norton of Chenango Forks watches his tee shot from the 7th tee during the STAC golf championship Tuesday at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Josh Goetz of Windsor watches his shot from the 10th tee during the STAC golf championship Tuesday at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Jake Marris of Maine-Endwell watches his shot from the 10th tee during the STAC golf championship Tuesday at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Tim Buchek of Windsor watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Hogan Bendert of Union-Endicott watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo A.J. Baykal of Seton Catholic Central watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Nick Barney, of Vestal, watches his tee shot at No. 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. Barney shot a 4-over 75 and led the Golden Bears to the team championship. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Jake Orban of Horsheads watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
"I was a little frustrated," Hepburn said about his trio of bogeys, "but I knew that I had a good drive on 13 and my approach shot was really good, and getting that eagle really turned the back nine around. As soon as I made that eagle, I got really excited and I knew that I had a shot." 
Finishing in second was the trio of Tommy Davis, of Seton Catholic Central; Ryan Johnson, of Norwich; and D.J. Griffiths, of Susquehanna Valley. 
Vestal's Nick Barney placed fifth at 4-over 75 and led the Golden Bears to their third team title in the past six seasons, with a five-man score of 393. Last week, Vestal captured the Section 4 Class A championship at Soaring Eagles Golf Course in Horseheads, with a record score of 376. 
"One of my parents last week said, 'Get the broom, we're going to have a sweep,'" Vestal coach Tony Policare said, referring to his team's capturing the three major fall golf events, including the season-opening DiNunzio Invitational in August. 
"It's been elusive; we've won one or two of them but never swept," Policare said. "It was really a lot of fun, and I'm excited for our guys as a team to come through and win all three of the major tournaments." 
Barney played with Griffiths and Davis, and saw his chances at the individual title take a hit when he made the turn in 4-over. But he played the back nine in even par, despite three-putts at holes 14 and 15, and kept grinding until the end. 
"I knew I still had to keep going for the team score," he said. "The other guys played really well and we got it done." 
Hepburn bogeyed Cornell's third hole — normally a par-4 but playing as a par-3 Tuesday because of ongoing reconstruction of the fairway — but got the stroke back with a birdie at No. 4. He then got to 1-under at the par-5 sixth hole, but gave it back when he was unable to get up and down for par at the ninth. 
After continuing his ride on the bogey train to start the back nine, he drained a 4-footer for eagle on 13, then capped his even-par round by sinking an 8-footer for birdie on 18. Hepburn was unsure of exactly how he stood in relation to the field, and could only focus on his game. 
"I knew the group in front of me was pretty close," he said, referring to Davis, Griffiths and Barney, "and that I needed to stay at around 1-over or even par if I wanted to win, and I did that." 
Other scorers for team champion Vestal included Jared Reester (76), Luke Barney (78), Zach Keesler (81) and Colin Sabitus (83). 
"I'm just proud of our kids, and this was an outstanding field," said Policare, whose squad also won STAC titles in 2010 and '12. "Some great, well-coached teams, great golfers, and these scores indicate objectively the quality of golf here. To have three (Vestal) kids shoot in the 70s today, that's great." 
Led by Hepburn, Corning finished second in the team race with a team total of 412, three shots better than third-place Seton. Horseheads was fourth (422), followed by Susquehanna Valley (434) and Chenango Forks (436). 
Host Ithaca had four players entered in the tournament, and was led by junior Nick Miller's 10-over-par 81. Buy Photo 
Derran Smith, of Ithaca, watches his tee shot fly on number 10 Tuesday during the STAC golf championship at Cornell University's Robert Trent Jones Golf Course. (Photo: SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo) 
Next up for area high school golfers are the Section 4 medalist and state championship tournaments, both held in the spring. 1 CONNECT 15 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ithacajr.nl/1LsX2g1 TOP VIDEOS
